summary: This document is an email chain from November 12, 2019, between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the case 'US v. Epstein'. It discusses the completion of document processing (unitization and coding) of data from 56 DVD files by a vendor, and logistics for returning the DVDs and reviewing the work product before uploading to the Relativity e-discovery platform.

events.title: Completion of Epstein Case Document Processing
events.description: A vendor finishes document unitization and coding of data from 56 DVD files for the US v. Epstein case, as reported in an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively processing evidence in the 'US v. Epstein' case as of November 2019.
Case evidence included data from 56 DVD files that required professional document unitization and coding by a vendor.
The prosecution team planned to upload the processed documents to the Relativity e-discovery platform for review.
The email chain indicates coordination among multiple personnel (including contractors) for handling physical media (DVDs) and digital work product.
